solution.text:
Volume of the cone\(=_{{trunc(((1/Decimal(3))*pi_val*k**2*j),3)}}_\,cm^3\)
Height of the cone, h\(=_{j}_\,cm\)
Volume of the cone\(=\frac13 \pi r^2h\)
\(\Rightarrow_{{trunc(((1/Decimal(3))*pi_val*k**2*j),3)}}_=\frac13 \pi \times r^2 \times _{j}_\)
\(\Rightarrow r^2=\frac{_{{trunc(((1/Decimal(3))*pi_val*k**2*j),3)}}_}{\frac13 \times \pi \times _{j}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow r^2=_{{k**2}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow r=_{k}_\,cm\)
Therefore, Diameter of the cone\(=2r=2 \times _{k}_=_{{2*k}}_\,cm\)

content.text:
If the volume of a right circular cone of height \(_{j}_\,cm\) is \(_{{trunc(((1/Decimal(3))*pi_val*k**2*j),3)}}_\,cm^3\), find:
The diameter of the cone.
